title.rendered: 10 Reasons to Move to Drupal 10 (and How To Migrate Easily in 2024)

content.rendered:
Drupal 10 is here, and it’s not just an update — it’s a revolution in website building! 

The new Drupal 10 is packed with features that enhance efficiency, user experience, and security. With Drupal 10, you can create stunning and functional websites with ease. 

If you’re using an older version of Drupal, you must migrate to 10 to see a new world  of possibilities for your website. But remember, that migration can be tricky and you may need Drupal migration services to help you with the migration process and ensure a smooth transition. 

Let’s dive deeper into 10 key improvements in Drupal 10 that will transform your website development experience for good.  

Top 10 Reasons to Move from Drupal 6 or 7 to Drupal 10

1. Olivero — A User-Friendly Face for Drupal

It’s time to leave behind Bartik! Olivero is the new default theme in Drupal 10 that has a sleek and modern interface that’s intuitive for everyone. 

With this theme, the navigation is extremely simple with a priority on accessibility. 

Olivero adheres to WCAG guidelines, ensuring your website is inclusive for users with disabilities.  With Olivero, creating new projects becomes lightning-fast.

2. Claro — A simple Backend for Content Creators

In Drupal 10, the backend gets a makeover too! 

The Claro theme replaces the older Seven theme and brings a user-friendly experience specifically designed for content creators — Imagine an admin panel where everything is in the correct place.

With Claro, admin tabs are strategically positioned for a smoother workflow, and mobile editing is easy. This translates to faster content creation and editing for your team, freeing them to focus on crafting engaging content.

3. Effortless Content Creation with CKEditor 5

CKEditor 5 replaced CKEditor 4, which served for over 10 years and was discontinued in 2023.

Say goodbye to the trouble of separate content creation tools! 

CKEditor 5 comes built-in with Drupal 10, eliminating the need for additional installation. 

Content creators will love features like in-line editing of links and images, allowing for a smooth and intuitive experience. 

Plus, CKEditor 5 automatically removes unwanted formatting when pasting text from external sources, saving valuable time and ensuring consistent formatting across your website.

4. Faster Loading Times with Modern Javascript

Remember the days of bulky jQuery libraries slowing down your website? 

Drupal 10 sheds weight by replacing outdated functionalities with modern JavaScript features that are now built into most browsers — no more errors!

This means significantly faster loading times for your website which will keep your visitors happy and engaged. 

A faster website not only improves user experience but also contributes to better search engine ranking, making your website more discoverable.

5. Build Custom Themes with Starterkit Theme Generator

Creating unique website themes is no longer a daunting task! 

The Starterkit theme generator allows you to build custom themes based on a core version, ensuring compatibility with future Drupal updates. 

In short, Startekit will eliminate the fear of breaking your website with each update. What’s more, is that keeping track of changes and incorporating improvements is easier than ever. 

With Starterkit Theme Generator, you will spend less time on technical worries and more time crafting a website that perfectly reflects your brand identity.

Drupal 7 Security Support Ends on 5 January 2025!

As per the official report from Drupal, Drupal 7 will no longer receive any security support after this date. So, it’s best that you migrate to Drupal 10 as soon as possible. Although the migration process can be complex, we can help you migrate to Drupal 10 easily with minimal downtime.

Start today

6. Enhanced Security with Symfony 6 and PHP 8.1

Security is extremely important in today’s digital world. Drupal 10 takes this seriously by implementing Symfony 6, which offers improved performance and essential bug fixes to keep your website protected from potential threats. 

Additionally, the upgrade to PHP 8.1 boosts website speed and strengthens security measures with the latest coding standards. 

This comprehensive approach in Drupal 10 ensures a secure environment for you and your visitors, increasing trust and confidence in your website.

7. Optimized Images for Faster Loading (WebP Support)

Did You Know?

Faster loading times not only improve user satisfaction but also contribute to better search engine ranking.

Get ready for a performance boost! Drupal 10 has introduced native support for WebP images, a format that delivers high-quality visuals with smaller file sizes. 

This means a smoother user experience and faster loading time of images, especially on mobile devices where bandwidth can be limited. 

8. Effortless Import & Export

With Drupal 10, content management will get more robust with built-in migration tools and web services. 

Partners can update your site smoothly, bulk import articles, or even feed content to mobile apps and partner websites.  This enhanced integration keeps your content flowing freely.

9. Streamlined Media Management

With Drupal 10, managing media assets will get easier! 

Drupal 10 offers improved media library management with better categorization options, enhanced search functionality, and advanced metadata management. 

This simplifies content creation by making media assets easier to find, organize, and reuse across your website.

10. Boost Search Ranking & Conversions with Rich Snippets

Drupal 10 supports modern markups like Schema.org, Microformats.org, Open Graph, and JSON-LD markup. 

This lets search engines understand your content better, leading to richer search results and potentially increased website traffic and conversions.

What if You Don’t Migrate to Drupal 10?

You can still use an older version of Drupal If you don’t wish to migrate to Drupal 10,  you’ll miss out on advanced features and other functionalities. 

While Drupal 6 and 7 served us well, it’s the right time to consider an upgrade. Here’s why:

 

  • Security Risks: Unsupported versions are hacker targets. Outdated modules and frameworks can have an entry point for hackers. 
  • Poor User Experience: Compatibility issues with old tech can lead to frustrating user experiences for visitors.
  • Costly Maintenance: Keeping an old system running requires custom fixes, driving up maintenance costs.
  • Data Loss Risk: Delaying migration increases the chance of data loss and website downtime. 
  • Compliance Challenges: Meeting regulations like GDPR or other guidelines becomes difficult with unsupported software.
  • Limited Modern Features: Drupal 6 & 7 lack features like WebP image support and modern JavaScript functionalities.
  • Future Compatibility Issues: Drupal 6 & 7 may become incompatible with future server environments and technologies.
  • Missed Out on Innovation: You miss out on the latest features, performance improvements, and user-friendly tools available in newer versions.

How to Migrate to Drupal 10?

Drupal 10 offers a powerful platform for businesses seeking enhanced security, performance, and user experience. However, migrating from older versions like Drupal 7 can present challenges like compatibility issues, data migration complexities, and the need for redesigning themes and custom modules. 

Proper planning and expert assistance can help ensure a smooth transition, allowing you to fully benefit from Drupal 10’s advanced features.  

 

Here’s where we step in as your trusted migration partner. We understand the complexities involved, including:

  • Compatibility Assessments: Not all modules and themes from previous versions integrate with Drupal 10. Our team will analyse your existing setup to identify potential compatibility issues.

 

  • Data Migration Planning: Moving large datasets requires a well-defined strategy. We’ll work closely with you to establish a comprehensive migration plan that ensures data integrity and minimizes disruption.

 

  • Downtime Mitigation: We understand the importance of website uptime. Our migration specialists employ techniques to minimize downtime during the process.

 

So, don’t let migration issues hinder your website. Contact us today and get ready to use the full potential of Drupal 10 for your business.

Final thoughts

Migrating to Drupal 10 offers numerous benefits — from modern themes like Olivero and Claro to advanced features like CKEditor 5, faster loading times with modern JavaScript, and enhanced security with Symfony 6 and PHP 8.1. With optimized images, streamlined media management, and built-in migration tools, Drupal 10 ensures a smooth, efficient, and secure website experience. By migrating to Drupal 10, you can embrace these features for a superior digital presence and boost your website’s performance and user engagement.
